info.description: This is the API for the Estuary application.
info.title: Estuary API

post.description: This endpoint registers a new autoretrieve server

get.description: This endpoint lists all registered autoretrieve servers
This endpoint can be used to list all peers on Peering Service

post.description: This endpoint can be used to add a Peer from the Peering Service

delete.description: This endpoint can be used to remove a Peer from the Peering Service

post.description: This endpoint can be used to start the Peering Service

get.description: This endpoint can be used to check the Peering status

post.description: This endpoint can be used to stop the Peering Service

get.description: This endpoint is used to get system configs.
This endpoint is used to get all users.

post.description: This endpoint updates the lastConnection field for autoretrieve

get.description: This endpoint is used to list all collections. Whenever a user logs on estuary, it will list all collections that the user has access to. This endpoint provides a way to list all collections to the user.

post.description: This endpoint is used to create a new collection. A collection is a representaion of a group of objects added on the estuary. This endpoint can be used to create a new collection.
This endpoint adds a file to a collection
post.summary: Add a file to a collection

get.description: This endpoint is used to get contents in a collection. If no colpath query param is passed

post.description: This endpoint adds already-pinned contents (that have ContentIDs) to a collection.

parameters.description: Content IDs to add to collection
parameters.name: contentIDs

delete.description: This endpoint is used to delete an existing collection.

post.description: This endpoint is used to save the contents in a collection, producing a top-level CID that references all the current CIDs in the collection.
post.summary: Produce a CID of the collection contents

delete.description: This endpoint is used to delete an existing content from an existing collection. If two or more files with the same contentid exist in the collection, delete the one in the specified path
delete.summary: Deletes a content from a collection

parameters.description: Variable to use when filtering for files (must be either 'path' or 'content_id')
parameters.name: body

post.description: This endpoint is used to upload new content.
This endpoint is used to add a car object to the network. The object can be a file or a directory.
This endpoint is used to add an IPFS object to the network. The object can be a file or a directory.

get.description: This endpoint returns aggregated content stats
This endpoint is used to get all deals for a user
get.summary: Get all deals for a user

get.description: This endpoint returns content bandwidth

post.description: This endpoint adds a new content

get.description: This endpoint lists all content with deals
This endpoint ensures that the content is replicated to the specified number of providers
This endpoint returns all failures for a content
get.summary: List all failures for a content

post.description: This endpoint imports a deal into the shuttle.

get.description: This endpoint lists all content
This endpoint reads content from the blockstore
This endpoint is used to get staging zone for user.

This endpoint is used to get content statistics. Every content stored in the network (estuary) is tracked by a unique ID which can be used to get information about the content. This endpoint will allow the consumer to get the collected stats of a conten
This endpoint returns the status of a content
This endpoint returns a content by its ID

post.description: This endpoint estimates the cost of a deal
post.summary: Estimate the cost of a deal

parameters.description: The size of the deal in bytes, the replication factor, and the duration of the deal in blocks
parameters.name: body

get.description: This endpoint returns the deal info for a deal
This endpoint returns the proposal for a deal
This endpoint returns the ask for a given CID
Get Deal Status by PropCid
This endpoint returns the status of a deal
This endpoint returns the in-progress transfers

post.description: This endpoint returns the status of a transfer

get.description: This endpoint returns a list of storage failures for user

post.description: This endpoint makes a deal for a given content and miner

get.description: This endpoint returns the status of a deal
This endpoint is used to get net addrs
This endpoint lists all pin status objects

post.description: This endpoint adds a pin to the IPFS daemon.

get.description: This endpoint returns a pin status object.

post.description: This endpoint replaces a pinned object.

delete.description: This endpoint deletes a pinned object.

get.description: This endpoint returns the content associated with a CID
This endpoint returns a list of storage failures
This endpoint returns information about the node
This endpoint is used to get deal metrics
This endpoint returns all miners
This endpoint returns all miners deals
This endpoint returns all miners
This endpoint returns miner stats
This endpoint returns the ask for a given CID
This endpoint is used to get net addrs
This endpoint is used to get net peers
This endpoint is used to get public stats.
This endpoint is used to get API keys for a user. In estuary, each user can be given multiple API keys (tokens). This endpoint can be used to retrieve all available API keys for a given user.
get.summary: Get API keys for a user

post.description: This endpoint is used to create API keys for a user. In estuary, each user is given an API key to access all features.
post.summary: Create API keys for a user

parameters.description: Expiration - Expiration - Valid time units are ns, us (or s),  ms,  s,  m,  h.  for  example  300h
parameters.name: expiry

delete.description: This endpoint is used to revoke a user API key. In estuary, every user is assigned with an API key, this API key is generated and issued for each user and is primarily used to access all estuary features. This endpoint can be used to revoke the API key that's assigned to the user. Revoked API keys are completely deleted and are not recoverable.

get.description: This endpoint is used to get API keys for a user.
This endpoint is used to create API keys for a user.
get.summary: Create API keys for a user
